article.headline: Western Michigan 96, Ohio 73
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. (AP) -- Levi Rost came off the bench to score a career-high 26 points Wednesday night and Western Michigan extended its home winning streak to 13 with a 96-73 victory over Ohio. Rost, a junior forward whose previous career high was 12 points, hit 7-of-10 shots and led four players who reached double figures for the Broncos (14-2, 7-1 Mid-American). After falling behind 6-5, a 22-4 run by put Western up by 17 points nine minutes into the game. The Broncos' 49 first-half points tied a season high and were the most scored against the Bobcats this season. Thomas Stephens led Ohio (5-13, 2-6) with 11 points. The loss was the Bobcats' seventh consecutive on the road and tied their most lopsided setback of the season. Wisconsin defeated them by 23 in December. Western center Anthony Kann reached 1,000 career points by scoring 15. Mike Williams had his third double-double of the season, with 18 points and 11 rebounds. Reggie Berry added 13.
